WOlfBlade::

She gave Malice a roll of the optics and looked at Windlord, "Are all 
the maxitrons here like this? If so, they act as if they are 
programmed to be Predatrons."


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> Malice scoffed and turned to Windlord.
> "I'm going to find some energon.  If Kup comes looking for me or 
needs me, tell him just outside the base entrance."
> He then marched past them both, his tail trailing behind him.  Sure 
enough, he detected a raw energon deposit.  It was buried in the 
rock, so Malice crushed the stone barrier.  Once he was finished, he 
beheld a extremly high density deposit of energon.  It would soon 
kill any Maximal or Predacon, but Malice was differant all together.  
His endurance and fuel efficentcy was superior to most.  He started 
tearing hunks of crystallized energon and stuffed them in his mouth, 
crunching them and swallowing before another handful filled his 
mouth.  He ate for ten straight minutes, before slowing down, and 
five minutes later he was pulling large, whole shards to take back to 
his quarters.  He carried the armful of toxic stuff into his chamber 
and put them in an upright storage locker.  He left his quarters and 
sought out Kup again.  He found him, still in the Cr room.  There was 
tension in the place as Malice picked out the lone Predacon and 
slowly approached him. 
> 
> shadowess_azogoth <shadowess_azogoth@y...> wrote:
> WOlfBlade. 
> 
> "Are you always this rude and impolite with those who are to be 
your 
> allies. If so, you show incredible lack of manner for one trying to 
> show how superior they are. Anyway, Yes, I know how to defeat him. 
> Myself and the Maxitrons have deafed him many times. He's tough, 
yes, 
> hard to take down, yes, and very adaptive. We have not been able to 
> take him down the same way twice. BUt he's not some 
supertranformer. 
> He's only 200 yards tall. It's not like he's as big as a planet. 
He's 
> just a pain n the tail. That's it."  She glared at Malice. "And by 
> the way, I've never said I beat him completely on my own. But I've 
> fought him enough to were it would only take ten of us and not the 
> whole base. WE would adapt to. I mean, sure he was evolving as 
well, 
> but he's not the smartest thing in the universe. He's too self 
> centered to think bout how to really grow in intelegence. Oh, and 
> Malice, the next time you decide to insult someone, please 
remember, 
> they may be the one watching your back when you most need it. I 
> already learned that lesson."  She looked at Windlord. "Well, let's 
> go inside. I'm starved. Please lead the way."
> 
> 
> 
>
